    • Method Detail

      • serialize

        public static java.lang.String serialize(@NonNull
                                         java.lang.String[] content)
        Serializes array with Strings, the output will be a single String. As a separator in the serialization will be used the double points char ':'.

        Example:
        Parameter: String[] { First, Second, Third }
        Returns: "First:Second:Third"

        Parameters:
        content - String[] - String array with the strings to serialize.
        Returns:
        String - The serialization result String.
        Since:
        1.0

      • deserializeStringArray

        public static java.lang.String[] deserializeStringArray(@NonNull
                                                        java.lang.String content)
        Deserializes a String and returns a String array. The serialized String separator must be the double points char ':'.

        Example:
        Parameter: "First:Second:Third"
        Returns: String[] { First, Second, Third }

        Parameters:
        content - String - The serialized String which will be deserialized.
        Returns:
        String[] - Returns a String array with deserialized Strings.
        Since:
        1.0

      • deserializeIntArray

        public static int[] deserializeIntArray(@NonNull
                                        java.lang.String asString)
        Deserializes a String and returns int array. The serialized String separator must be the double points char ':'.

        Example:
        Parameter: "100:200:300"
        Returns: int[] { 100, 200, 300 }

        Parameters:
        asString - String - The serialized String which will be deserialized.
        Returns:
        int[] - Returns int array with deserialized integers.
        Since:
        1.0
